channel.title: Help with server
channel.description:
I have done everything to run a server but its not running. I think it is the no-ip part or the portforwarding.
Can someone help me if yours helps i'll make you a co-owner

item.title: Help with server
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

beepbe:

Can someone help me if yours helps i’ll make you a co-owner

Wow? I’m so gonna help, pls mkae me cow owna mr gud sevra?
LOL.

No point offering co-owner, if we want owner, and we can code. Then we will just make our own server and save the time?

Anyway, if you want to connect, use one of the 2 following ips…

127.0.0.1
localhost

Note: This only works for you if YOU are running the server.

If you want other people to connect, try makign them test your IP. If not then port forward again. There are MANY guides/tutorials.

[u]How to check my ip?[/u]
Press start, then click on run.
a Run box will load up, in the field type “cmd” (No quotation marks).
Press ok, now a command box will open. Type “ipconfig” (No quotation marks) and press enter.
You will now see your information, just highlight your ip address, press enter and you can paste it onto a textpad or anywhere to give it to people.

Read full topic
